t: Psalm 107
BOOK V
Psalms 107–150
Give*pn thanks to the Lord,*s for he is good; his*ld love endures forever.
Let*pn the redeemed of the Lord*s tell their story— those*ld he redeemed from the hand of the foe,
those*ln he gathered from the lands, from*ld east and west, from north and south.
Some*pn wandered in desert wastelands, finding*ld no way to a city where they could settle.
They*ln were hungry and thirsty, and*ld their lives ebbed away.
Then*ln they cried out to the Lord*s in their trouble, and*ld he delivered them from their distress.
He*ln led them by a straight way to*ld a city where they could settle.
Let*ln them give thanks to the Lord*s for his unfailing love and*ld his wonderful deeds for mankind,
for*ln he satisfies the thirsty and*ld fills the hungry with good things.
Some*pn sat in darkness, in utter darkness, prisoners*ld suffering in iron chains,
because*ln they rebelled against God’s commands and*ld despised the plans of the Most High.
So*ln he subjected them to bitter labor; they*ld stumbled, and there was no one to help.
Then*ln they cried to the Lord*s in their trouble, and*ld he saved them from their distress.
He*ln brought them out of darkness, the utter darkness, and*ld broke away their chains.
Let*ln them give thanks to the Lord*s for his unfailing love and*ld his wonderful deeds for mankind,
for*ln he breaks down gates of bronze and*ld cuts through bars of iron.
Some*pn became fools through their rebellious ways and*ld suffered affliction because of their iniquities.
They*ln loathed all food and*ld drew near the gates of death.
Then*ln they cried to the Lord*s in their trouble, and*ld he saved them from their distress.
He*ln sent out his word and healed them; he*ld rescued them from the grave.
Let*ln them give thanks to the Lord*s for his unfailing love and*ld his wonderful deeds for mankind.
Let*ln them sacrifice thank offerings and*ld tell of his works with songs of joy.
Some*pn went out on the sea in ships; they*ld were merchants on the mighty waters.
They*ln saw the works of the Lord,*s his*ld wonderful deeds in the deep.
For*ln he spoke and stirred up a tempest that*ld lifted high the waves.
They*ln mounted up to the heavens and went down to the depths; in*ld their peril their courage melted away.
They*ln reeled and staggered like drunkards; they*ld were at their wits’ end.
Then*ln they cried out to the Lord*s in their trouble, and*ld he brought them out of their distress.
He*ln stilled the storm to a whisper; the*ld waves of the sea were hushed.
They*ln were glad when it grew calm, and*ld he guided them to their desired haven.
Let*ln them give thanks to the Lord*s for his unfailing love and*ld his wonderful deeds for mankind.
Let*ln them exalt him in the assembly of the people and*ld praise him in the council of the elders.
He*pn turned rivers into a desert, flowing*ld springs into thirsty ground,
and*ln fruitful land into a salt waste, because*ld of the wickedness of those who lived there.
He*ln turned the desert into pools of water and*ld the parched ground into flowing springs;
there*ln he brought the hungry to live, and*ld they founded a city where they could settle.
They*ln sowed fields and planted vineyards that*ld yielded a fruitful harvest;
he*ln blessed them, and their numbers greatly increased, and*ld he did not let their herds diminish.
Then*pn their numbers decreased, and they were humbled by*ld oppression, calamity and sorrow;
he*ln who pours contempt on nobles made*ld them wander in a trackless waste.
But*ln he lifted the needy out of their affliction and*ld increased their families like flocks.
The*ln upright see and rejoice, but*ld all the wicked shut their mouths.
Let*pn the one who is wise heed these things and*ld ponder the loving deeds of the Lord.*s
